flawed_nl_solution:
Johannes was able to sell $30 / $2 = <<30/2=15>>15 kilograms last Wednesday.
He was able to sell $24 / $2 = <<24/2=21>>21 kilograms last Friday.
And he was able to sell $42 / $2 = <<42/2=21>>21 kilograms today.
Therefore, Johannes was able to sell is 15 + 21 + 21 = <<57=57>>57 kilograms of cabbage.
#### 57

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 21. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
